name: Holiday Inn & Suites Phoenix Airport North

reviews.text: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Phoenix Airport North for a week during spring training. The hotel is an "all suite" facility, in which all the rooms have a living room with a wet bar, a sleeper sofa, and a desk. The bedroom has a laughably small balcony, and possibly the smallest bathroom I've encountered outside an airplane. My only true complaint is that you can't control the thermostat. They have one in the room, but the front desk informed me maintenance controls the ac/heat. That's a little maddening to me. Overall, though, the room was more than adequate.
reviews.title: Nice facility, a little strangely managed

reviews.text: The grounds are quite nice. They have a couple outdoor sitting areas with fireplaces, a gazebo, and a nice outdoor pool. They also have a bar and restaurant, which I did not try. The location leaves something to be desired. There isn't really anything within walking distance, although I think they will shuttle you down to the light rail station. It's also >5 min to sky harbor.
reviews.title: 10 Minutes From Airport, Close to Shopping

reviews.text: The staff was somewhat puzzling. I can't really put my finger on what the problem was, but it seemed to be mismanaged. I did not get the answers to the questions I wanted, and they made no attempt to rectify my relatively minor requests.
reviews.title: A great place to stay

reviews.text: I used points for this stay, at a discount over other IHG properties in the area, and for that price I'm satisfied. I would not be happy having paid over $90 per night here though.
reviews.title: Fine for a Night

reviews.text: These rooms look like they were an Embassy Suites at one time. You have a separate living room with a pull out sofa bed. There are 2 flat screen tv's, one in the living room and one in the bedroom. There is a microwave, coffee maker and refrigerator. Paper towels, paper plates & silverware are provided. They offer a free shuttle to airport and local area places and there is a CVS and supermarket right across the street. There is a bar and restaurant in the lobby along with a Starbucks coffee bar. Unfortunately the coffee bar was never open during my 5 day stay. But there is another one a mile up the road along with a Target, Costco, Sears, Ross and several fast food restaurants. The room was a little musty and it took some time for the ac to cool it down. I did appreciate the sliding door to the balcony for fresh air. This property does sit on a busy street so prepare to hear traffic. The grounds are nicely maintained and overall the property is very clean. There is a small snack area by the front desk. Make sure you get the WIFI code at the desk upon check in. I experienced no connectivity issues and there are plenty of outlets in the room. The fitness room is open 24 hours and has several treadmills and a variety of weights.
reviews.title: Decent breakfast, good, but noisy rooms

reviews.text: I stayed at the Holiday Inn for a quick in/out business trip. I'm a very picky traveler (elite status at Hilton, Marriott, Hyatt properties) and this hotel was a good choice. The rooms were clean, the onsite dining options were decent and the location was perfect.
reviews.title: Perfect Overnight Hotel for Business Trip

reviews.text: While the rooms surrounding the pool aren't entirely protected from the noise, the noise does not travel to the interior bedroom when the door is closed.
reviews.title: Convenient to airport with shuttle

reviews.text: The workout facility was very clean and well maintained. It had what I needed for a decent workout.
reviews.title: Couldn't believe how nice it was!

reviews.text: The on property breakfast was good.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will return to this hotel next time I am in PHX
reviews.title: Plenty of room for a longer stay

reviews.text: I travel to Phoenix for work and we typically stay at a hotel down the road but since that hotel was all booked, I opted to stay at the Holiday Inn. I was extremely impressed when I walked in - I had never seen a Holiday Inn with such large, clean rooms and modern feel to it. I only stayed for the night but the pools looked very nice. It is more of a small resort than a normal Holiday Inn.
reviews.title: Very close to airport, convenient location with clean, large rooms

reviews.text: If you're looking to be close to the airport, this is a great hotel. I imagine if you have kids this would be nice because of the outdoor space. Only 15 minutes from Scottsdale.
reviews.title: Formerly Embassy Suites - updated and remodeled. Near Airport. Free airport shuttle as needed & within a 5 mile radius
Not your mother's Holiday Inn
reviews.text: Rooms are updated and attractive! Separate living room. My room had some water damage to the ceiling and wall behind the wet bar. The vanity lighting is not good for makeup application. 2 flat screen TVs. Sofa opens to bed. No Internet connection issues and sufficient # of outlets. 2 tier desk. I appreciated the roll of paper towels, paper plates, plastic silverware, covered microwave dish, and pot holder! It would have been nice to have info in the room about the hotel and amenities, info about the area, delivery menus, etc. Lots of drawers for storage, but a small closet. Can hear courtyard/pool noises and people walking by/pulling luggage as if they are in your room. The group in the spa were loud and i wanted to go to sleep early since I had to get up at 3am for an early flight. The restaurant is open 6 - 10 am, but it's not free, like Embassy Suites offered. The fitness center and business center are open 24/7. Rooms 01-13 and 50 - 59 are closest to the lobby and elevators. Rooms 24 - 30, 37-46 are near elevator and back parking lot. Rooms 15-22 are near elevator and front parking lot. Starbucks is located in the lobby. The clerk that checked me in was distracted, didn't explain anything to me - just handed me the key and a map to find my own way. Her co-worker must have noticed how I was treated, gave me some bottled water and thanked me for being a Priority Club member. Later, the shuttle driver brought me a breakfast coupon that should have been given to me at check-in. (The driver took awhile to pick me up at the airport, but turned out to be friendly and very helpful.)

This is our second stay at this Holiday Inn. The grounds are lovely, the room was modern and clean and the entire staff could not have been more helpful and accommodating. The pool area is inviting and actually has useable hours (6am-midnight). We were there during the busy Spring training and still felt as though our stay was appreciated.
reviews.title: Average Hotel for Business Trip

reviews.text: I recently stayed here for a 3 day business trip and this is definitely an average hotel and nothing to set it apart. For the price my company paid it was comfortable and I had more than enough space in the 'suite'. I spent one evening having drinks at the bar, which a huge plus has very good happy hours that vary depending on the night of the week. I had a spinach dip appetizer that was nothing special and tasted like it was most likely pre-made and just heated up. The service from the bartender was very good though and he checked in on me multiple times.
reviews.title: Not great, not bad, just OK

reviews.text: Arrived late here one night around 11 PM. Took at cab from the airport and it was very convenient. The check in went very smooth and room was very clean.
reviews.title: Very Convenient to Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only problem was that the restaurant and lounge on site closes at 10 PM. In showing up late, we were out of luck for food, except for the convenience store down the street, chips and hot pockets at the hotel store, or the IHOP and Applebees about 2 miles away. The hotel shuttle brought us to the restaurant, but they stopped running at 12 midnight, so we had to take a cab back. Fortunately the waitress at IHOP provided us with a cab, for return...
reviews.title: Great value!

reviews.text: I used the fitness center for cardio and free weights in the AM and it was adequate for a good workout and had a great breakfast buffet in the hotel restaurant the next AM.
reviews.title: Perfect for last minute deals
Had everything I needed.
reviews.text: All in all, convenient spot, close to Sky Harbor airport to get a good nights sleep, whether you are coming or going from a vacation in AZ.

A very modern hotel with a room beyond our expectations for the price. The inner court with a beautiful swimming pool was immaculate and pretty with trees and ornamental plants. Terrific value. The morning fruit bowl in the restaurant was huge and fresh.
reviews.title: VERY COMFORTABLE ROOM

aka: Holiday Inn And Suites Phoenix Airport North
